programs.title: Comprehensive health promotion and service delivery
programs.summary: Confidential health navigation, testing referrals, and PrEP/PEP supportfor everyone, stigma-free, and centered on dignity.
programs.description:
We strengthen access to essential health services through education, confidential navigation and referrals, and HIV/STI prevention supportso individuals can get accurate information, the right services, and follow-up care without judgment.

What we do

  • Private oneonone health navigation and referrals
  • HIV and STI testing referrals and followup support
  • PrEP/PEP information and medication navigation support
  • Support with appointments, continuity of care, and linkage to services
  • Safersex education and harmreduction resources

How it works

Reach out via our appointment form. A trained community navigator will respond, understand your needs, and connect you to the right supportconfidentially.

Our commitment

  • Confidentiality and informed consent
  • Traumainformed, nonjudgmental support
  • Respect for every identity and experience

programs.title: GenderAffirming Care Navigation
programs.summary: Respectful guidance for trans and gender-diverse people seeking safe, affirming healthcare and trusted referrals.
programs.description:
Trans and genderdiverse people deserve care that recognizes who they are. We offer navigation support and referrals to services that prioritize dignity and safety.

What we support

  • Affirming provider referrals and appointment support
  • Information on genderaffirming care options
  • Peer support and community connection

Our approach

We listen first. Then we help you find safe pathways to careat your pace, with informed consent and confidentiality.

programs.title: Mental Health & Peer Support Circles
programs.summary: Traumainformed spaces for connection, healing, and resiliencefacilitated by trained peers.
programs.description:
Living through stigma and exclusion can take a real toll. Our peer support circles offer a safer space for community connection and mental wellbeing.

What you can expect

  • Peerled support circles and wellbeing checkins
  • Stress management tools and coping strategies
  • Referrals to affirming mental health professionals where available

Values

  • Confidentiality and consent
  • Kindness, respect, and nonjudgment
  • Community care and shared strength

programs.title: Human rights, gender and social justice
programs.summary: Knowyourrights education, case support, and referrals to trusted legal partners when rights are threatened.
programs.description:
Health and safety are deeply connected to rights. We support community members with information and referrals when they face discrimination, harassment, or other rights violations.

Support includes

  • Knowyourrights sessions and safety planning
  • Documentation and case support
  • Referrals to vetted legal aid partners

Goal

To help people stay safe, informed, and supportedwhile strengthening community resilience.

programs.title: Economic empowerment, economic autonomy and digital competence
programs.summary: Workshops, mentorship, and digital skills to strengthen economic independencebecause dignity includes opportunity.
programs.description:
Economic empowerment reduces vulnerability and supports wellbeing. This program builds practical skills and connects people to opportunities in a supportive, communityaffirming way.

Activities

  • Skills workshops and learning circles
  • CV support, mentorship, and peer networking
  • Referral pathways for training and opportunities

Why we do this

When people have access to resources and opportunity, they can thriveon their own terms.

programs.title: Awareness & Consciousness Creation
programs.summary: Enhancing protection for LGBTQI+ communities while strengthening acceptance, tolerance, and community safety.
programs.description:
This program strengthens community protection and movement building by improving understanding of human rights, increasing awareness of available services, and engaging both state and non-state actors to reduce stigma and discrimination.

Key focus areas

  • Enhancing protection for LGBTQI+ communities
  • Stimulating movement building and community solidarity
  • Reducing stigma, discrimination, and human rights violations

What we aim to reduce

  • Arbitrary arrest and unlawful detention
  • Ill-treatment and extortion
  • Stigma and discrimination in community and service settings

Support: This project is supported and funded by ISDAO.

programs.title: Organizational Leadership, Governance & Management
programs.summary: A 6-month capacity building initiative to strengthen SEQHER staff leadership, governance, and management skills.
programs.description:
This initiative provides structured training and mentorship to strengthen SEQHERs leadership, governance, and management capacity as a foundation for effective service delivery and sustainable impact.

Duration

6 months

Partners

  • Piloted by GrantsHub
  • Funded by Kaleidoscope

programs.title: SEQHER ABODE (Safe Housing)
programs.summary: A 12-month safe-housing initiative supporting 50 displaced individuals from gender-diverse and sexual minority communities in Borno State, Nigeria.
programs.description:
SEQHER ABODE is a safe-housing facility designed to respond to the complex challenges faced by displaced gender-diverse and sexual minority communities in Borno State, Nigeria.

What it provides

  • Safe accommodation and case support
  • Referrals for health, legal, and psychosocial services
  • Support to address homelessness, violence, and discrimination

Scale

Support for 50 displaced individuals over 12 months.

Funding: This project is funded by Rainbow Railroad.

programs.title: Climate Change, Justice & Resilience
programs.summary: Community-led climate awareness and resilience work that centers justice, safety, and dignity for vulnerable populations.
programs.description:
Climate change is already impacting health, livelihoods, and safetyespecially for vulnerable and marginalized communities. This program strengthens community resilience and advances climate justice through education, preparedness, and locally grounded solutions.

What we do

  • Climate and health awareness in community settings
  • Risk reduction, safety planning, and preparedness support
  • Community dialogues linking climate impacts to rights and equity
  • Partnerships that strengthen local resilience and response

Goal

To reduce vulnerability and improve wellbeing by building resilient communitieswhere support reaches those most affected.

programs.title: Youth Justice & Protection
programs.summary: Support, protection, and rights-based advocacy for young people and marginalized communities facing stigma, exclusion, or rights violations.
programs.description:
This program strengthens protection and access to justice for young people and marginalized communitiesthrough safe reporting pathways, rights education, and support that prioritizes confidentiality and dignity.

Focus areas

  • Know-your-rights education and community legal literacy
  • Safety planning and referral pathways for support services
  • Documentation and response support for rights violations
  • Community dialogue and advocacy to reduce stigma and discrimination

Goal

To ensure young people can live safely, access support, and claim their rightswithout fear.

programs.title: Educational Programmes & Campaigns
programs.summary: Community education and public campaigns that build knowledge, reduce stigma, and promote healthier, more equal communities.
programs.description:
We run educational programmes and campaigns that share accurate information, shift harmful norms, and strengthen community understandingusing culturally responsive messaging and locally relevant channels.

What we deliver

  • Community education sessions and peer learning
  • School- and community-based awareness campaigns
  • Information materials designed for local languages and contexts
  • Digital outreach to reach young people and underserved communities

Goal

To improve access to knowledge and opportunitiesso people can make informed choices and live with dignity.

blogPosts.title: World Health Day 2024
blogPosts.content: World Health Day is observed on April 7 to raise awareness about pressing health issues, promote healthy lifestyles, and advocate for universal access to quality healthcare. The theme of World Health Day 2024 is "My health, my right". This years theme was chosen to champion the right of everyone, everywhere to have access to quality health services, education, and information, as well as safe drinking water, clean air, good nutrition, quality housing, decent working and environmental conditions, and freedom from discrimination," the World Health Organisation (WHO) has said.
blogPosts.author: Admin

blogPosts.title: Capacity Development Intervention mentorship program
blogPosts.content:
On May 18th, the SEQHER team began a 6-month Capacity Development Intervention mentorship with the GrantsHub services team from Nairobi, Kenya, thanks to the support of The KT.

This mentorship program focuses on "Effective Organizational Leadership, Governance, and Management" to improve the team''s skills and knowledge in these crucial areas.

We believe that this mentorship will greatly enhance our ability to provide top-notch services to the community and reinforce our dedication to excellence.

We are thankful to KT for giving us the chance to participate in this intervention.
blogPosts.author: Admin

blogPosts.title: Open Position For Program Assistant
blogPosts.content:
• Position Title: Program Assistant
  • Location: Borno State, Nigeria
  • Contract Duration: 1 December 2025 30 April 2026 (6 months, with possibility of extension up to 18 MONTHS).
  • Release Date: Monday, October 27, 2025
  • Application Deadline: November 14, 2025

About SEQHER

The Society for Equal Health and Rights (SEQHER) works to advance health equity and human rights for KEY POPULATION people and other marginalized populations in Nigeria. We focus on improving access to HIV/AIDS services, gender justice, and community-led advocacy through research, partnerships, and inclusive program implementation.

Position Summary

SEQHER is seeking a Program Assistant to support the implementation of KEY POPULATION health and HIV/AIDS partnership programs in Borno State. The successful candidate will assist in delivering community-based initiatives that promote equitable service access and strengthen local partnerships.

This role is based in Borno State for the duration of the contract and offers a strong opportunity for extension based on performance and funding availability.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the delivery and day-to-day coordination of KEY POPULATION and HIV/AIDS program activities in Borno.
  • Assist in implementing outreach, training, and community engagement initiatives.
  • Work collaboratively with the Program Lead, Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Team, and Research and Advocacy Team to ensure timely and effective project delivery.
  • Contribute to program documentation, data collection, and reporting.
  • Maintain effective communication and relationships with local stakeholders, community groups, and implementing partners.
  • Support logistical arrangements for program meetings, training, and community events.
  • Uphold SEQHERs values of inclusion, diversity, and respect in all program engagements.

Required Qualifications and Experience

  • A bachelor''s degree/Higher National Diploma in any relevant discipline.
  • Minimum of 2 years of verifiable experience in a similar role (including but not limited to program delivery, community outreach, or NGO work).
  • Understanding of HIV/AIDS programs implementation in Nigeria.
  • High proficiency in English and Nigerian Pidgin; working knowledge of Hausa and being a resident of Borno State is highly desirable.
  • Working knowledge of program implementation and service delivery within community or health-focused projects.
  • Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.

Preferred Candidate Profile

  • An individual who identifies as part of the KEY POPULATION community, or an ALLY with a strong commitment to human rights, gender equality, and inclusion in Nigeria.
  • Resident in, or willing to relocate to, Borno State for the contract duration.

How to Apply

Interested applicants should submit: PLEASE, MERGE THEM INTO A PDF SINGLE DOCUMENT.

  1. A cover letter (max 1.5 pages) detailing relevant experience and motivation for applying.
  2. A current CV (max 5 pages).

Applications should be sent by email to job@seqher.org and copy alfred@seqher.org with the subject line: Program Assistant Borno

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Send questions and enquiries to: Society for Equal Health and Rights

info@seqher.org; and copy seqher2020@gmail.com
blogPosts.author: Admin

blogPosts.title: MENTAL HEALTH PODCAST
blogPosts.content:
Mental health is a major issue in the world today. It is not a topic that is often discussed, and it can be difficult to know how to deal with it.

However, mental health is an important thing to discuss because it affects many people and can lead to other problems if left untreated. Its important to talk about what mental health is, what causes mental health problems, and how you can help someone who has mental health issues.
blogPosts.author: Admin

blogPosts.title: International Human Rights Day 2023
blogPosts.content:
The theme for Human Rights Day 2023 is "Freedom, Equality and Justice for All".
The main objective is to end human rights violations where some people are deprived of basic requirements like food, shelter, education, hygiene, and a safe place to grow and create opportunities for growth. This is a step in the right direction to maintain peace and sanity in this ever-growing greedy and violent world. And it takes part in the Global Event wherein people celebrate the goodness in differences of human beings.

The day is celebrated across the world to:
Promote awareness about human rights among the people, Get together and celebrate in co-operation to discuss and highlight the specific issues of the human rights, Encourage the vulnerable group of people like women, minorities, youth, poor, disabled person, indigenous people etc. to take part in this event and political decision-making.

humanrightsday #internationalhumanrightsday #humanright #equality

internationalhumanrights #16DaysOfActivismAgainstGenderBasedViolence #USAID #16DaysOfActivism
blogPosts.author: Admin
